'''Terra Swoop Force''' is a [[Marketplace]] map released on December 28, 2020 on both ''[[Java Edition]]'' and ''[[Bedrock Edition]]'' as part of the [[Community Celebration]] event. It is an [[elytra]]-based course with a storyline where players have to reach the end to learn what is at the center of the Earth.<ref>{{tweet|Minecraft|1312443373064613888|Coming soon for free on Minecraft Marketplace, Terra Swoop Force by Noxcrew – and it's been updated for Java Edition too!<br><br>↣ redsto.ne/live ↢|October 3, 2020}}</ref>

== Summary ==
Terra Swoop Force is an adventure map where the player tries to discover the center of the Earth. The player is encouraged to enter the GDL (Geo Descent Lab) building and dive into the mysteries and knowledge of the tunnels leading to the core. They are given a wingsuit to fly through three tunnels, where they meet Dr. Barney, who eventually sacrifices himself to the pulsing core, causing the world to explode.
=== Spawn ===
The map begins inside of an info room, themed around an office building and laboratory. Beside the [[Iron Door|spawn point]] is a chair covered in [[Book|books]] from [[Bookshelf|bookshelves]], with a [[Concrete|red path]] leading to the map itself. Along the road are a set off [[Smooth Red Sandstone Stairs|desks]] with chairs and computers, across from a promotion for the map's two prequels, [[Monsters of the Deep]] and [[Monsters from the Ice]]. In the next room over are a set of white potted plants, beside toggles for closed captioning and a test for the captions, as well as a [[button]] that says Noxcrew. Opposite of the caption buttons are a speaker used to test the map's unique sound design, next to a model of a drill machine behind [[Iron Bars|iron bars]]. In a third room is a promotion for Noxcrew's social media platforms of the time, beside a teleporter hooked up to the drill. Pressing another button will open a portal into the proper story.
=== GDL Lab ===
The player will spawn inside of a helicopter with several rows of seats, stationed outside a GDL facility in a forest. Along the path to the building is a [[Purpur Block|purpur]] structure, Stan's Bouncy Castle, installed with [[Slime Block|slime blocks]]. Entering the building starts a dialogue with a receptionist named Sasha.

=== Core Drill ===
The player is teleported into the Core Drill as the suit senses life forms nearby. The player then encounters Dr. Barney, his first time with human contact in 30 years. The player soon founds out he has gone insane with a deceased Dr. Minnowski (reduced to a skeleton) lies on the floor. Dr. Barney pleads to try on the suit which the player is currently wearing as he is fascinated by the advancement of technology during his time stuck at the drill.

After wearing the suit, he feels exhilarated and opens the door to the core and sacrifices himself to it. A cutscene is then shown to the core and tunnels blowing up as the credits scroll past, completing the end of the story.

The player enters a vertical tunnel and is soon teleported to the core drill's newest tunnel creation.

<<span class="format-d">Dr. Barney<span class="format-f">> I don't even know how long it's been since Dr. Minnowski left my side.
<<span class="format-d">Dr. Barney<span class="format-f">> Well...
<<span class="format-d">Dr. Barney<span class="format-f">> After we ran out of actual food we had to train our stomachs to survive off...

<<span class="format-d">Dr. Barney<span class="format-f">> And y'know...

== Trophy Room ==
=== Noxesium ===
Noxesium is a in-universe rock which can be collected in each tunnel. This can be combined with a cow's udder, a few gummy bears, dried washing-up liquid and a spleen of a rabbit at 3456 degrees to create the wingsuit.

15 unique Noxesiums can be collected equally in each tunnel with 5 bonus Dark Noxesiums in the Frozen Tunnel.

== Trivia ==
* "TFA-1541" is a reference to [[Java Edition 15w41a]], the snapshot which introduced the elytra.<ref>{{ytl|FK_YVFy_m1o|The Top 20 Details you probably missed in Terra Swoop Force (Minecraft Adventure Map)|Noxcrew|May 04, 2016|t=1m56s}}</ref>
* On January 26, 2021, the creators of the map were interviewed by Mojang about their creative process.<ref>{{tweet|Minecraft|1354097633711837186|How do you turn a gut feeling into a fully-fledged map? And how do you go about truly immersing a player into the universe you create?<br><br>The makers of Terra Swoop Force and Simburbia sat down to talk through their creative processes:<br><br>↣ youtu.be/HZtio0wZCRs ↢<br><br>Community Celebration: Creating Terra Swoop Force and Simburbia|January 26, 2021}}</ref>
** Prior to becoming an official map, a similar interview was conducted.<ref>{{Mcnet|making-terra-swoop-force|The Making of Terra Swoop Force|December 17, 2016|Marsh Davies}}</ref>
*Several of the death messages reference various pieces of popular culture.{{More info}}
**Three messages refer to the 2017 [[Mob Vote]], where the losing candidates were the [[barnacle]], [[wildfire]], and [[great hunger]].
**One message refers to "flying too close to the sun, referring to the myth of {{Wikipedia|Icarus}}.
**Several are devoted to slang terms, such as yeeting, boomer, and zoomer.
**One references a scene in ''{{Wikipedia|Avengers: Infinity War}}'' wherein {{Wikipedia|Spider-Man}} remarks he "doesn't feel so good" before disintegrating.
**One namedrops Parkour Warrior, a minigame from [[MC Championship]].
**Several reference the [[Avatar Legends]] franchise, including the in-universe film [https://avatar.fandom.com/wiki/The_Adventures_of_Nuktuk:_Hero_of_the_South Nuktuk: Hero of the South], and the catchphrase of recurring character [https://avatar.fandom.com/wiki/Iknik_Blackstone_Varrick Varrick], "do the thing."
**One is a reference to furniture company {{Wikipedia|IKEA}}, which is known for having large stores easy to get lost in.
**One is a reference to the game {{Wikipedia|Mario Kart 8}}, where players can use prewritten messages in the lobby, including "I'm using tilt controls!"<ref>{{Citation|url=https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/im-using-tilt-controls|title=I'm Using Tilt Controls!|author=[https://knowyourmeme.com/users/freezie Freezie]|website=Know Your Meme|date=March 7, 2019}}</ref>
**One jokes that the player "thought this was a "find the button" map," referring to a common genre of map.
**One references the robot [https://robotwars.fandom.com/wiki/Sir_Killalot Sir Killalot], from the television series ''{{Wikipedia|Robot Wars (TV series)|Robot Wars}}''.
